item.title: Couchdbkit version 0.6.0 released
item.description:
New release for Couchdbkit.

It’s now based on latest restkit
4.0x so make sure to upgrade it before upgrading. I
Full changelog is also
here

item.title: Listen to database changes
item.description:
Since the 0.10 release of CouchDB, it’s possible to listen on db changes via the REST api.

The `couchdbkit.Consumer` object provides you a way to listen on these changes asynchronously (continuous changes) or just wait for one change (longpolling). You can of course just fetch changes since the last update sequence.

item.title: Listen to database changes
item.description:
couchdbkit 0.6.0 introduced a new API to listen for CouchDB changes.

The `couchdbkit.changes` modules allows you to listen for changes with a
streaming API.

item.title: Couchdbkit website launched
item.description:
Just launched Couchdbkit site at couchdbkit.org.

All this website is static. For this purpose I wrote a script to generate doc and news from differents text files. The Lamson project used this idee for its own site, and I found it very usefull. I preferred to write mine script to allow use of jinja and some other changes (it will be possible for example to generate a cloud).

item.title: Couchdbkit version 0.1.7 released
item.description:

Next version will be 0.2 and will have some new features :

item.title: Couchdbkit version 0.3 released - pre-awesome
item.description:
New release for Couchdbkit. This release fix a lot of oddities from previous version and prepare for next version.

You can download latest release on Pypi or check download page for other ways.

item.title: Couchdbkit version 0.4 released
item.description:
New release for Couchdbkit. More fixes and new `External` and _changes `Consumer`. The 0.4 branch is the last branch with suport for 0.9x / 0.10x versions of CouchDB. Next releases will support only 0.11/trunk and 1.0 versions and will support python3. The TODO has been updated.

You can download latest release on Pypi or check download page for other ways.

item.title: Sources and Tracker have been moved to github
item.description:
Since I worked more and more with git and github, I decided to move Couchdbkit and Restkit to it:

  • couchdbkit
  • restkit
